explanation: The bug was that after finding a valid permutation the code used break to exit the for-loop, but the program then continued and unconditionally executed print("No"). That can cause both "Yes" and "No" to be printed (or "No" printed even after a solution was found). I fixed it by replacing the single incorrect line (the break) with raise SystemExit so the program exits immediately after printing "Yes" and never reaches the final print("No").
